title: John Fitzgerald Kennedy National Historic Site: Teens
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth     Teens               Teens       Upcoming Events:         Art, Yoga, and Tea   Friday, February 19 1:00 pm to 3:00 pm   Olmsted NHS teams with Lesley University's Eco-psychology professor, Jeffrey Perrin to offer Art, Yoga, and Tea. Inspired by Healthy Parks Healthy People, this event combines artistic expression, the practice of Amrit yoga and chat about the relationship between nature and our well-being. Participants should bring water, and wear comfortable clothing for yoga. Advance registration is required by contacting Adrienne Sharigian at (617) 396-7918, or by registering on Eventbrite before February 17th. This event is free, and yoga mats are provided.                Interview Skills Workshop Saturday, March 5 11:00 am to 12:30 pm Learn what to do before, during and after an interview. Register Here.         Summer Employment:         Stewards of the Future Have you ever wondered what it's like to work for the National Park Service? Do you enjoy meeting and interacting with people from all over the world? Are you fascinated by historical people and places? If so, this opportunity is for you! During your 8 weeks at a historic site in Brookline or Cambridge, you'll learn what it means to be a park ranger with the National Park Service. During this summer experience you'll interact with people from all over the world, develop leadership skills, strengthen teamwork abilities, add to your resume, and get paid while doing it! You'll also spend time with some of our nation's most important and compelling historic and cultural resources and help visitors understand and connect with them. Want to learn more?
